title: Do humans really need technology? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. You might consider computers, smart phones as technology while dismissing the idea that many older things are all technology. For example, farming is a technology, without it, we will not be able to maintain the current human population. Even in early hunter & gatherer civilisations, technology comes in the form of weapons and tools. The available food will be greatly reduced if there are none. Another example will be technologies to obtain water. If you have no technology, the only possible method to obtain fresh water is from rivers and springs. No, digging wells will not be possible. You can dig by hand, but you will not be able to understand where to dig. You might get lucky, but your hit rate will be less than 1% and you will die of dehydration before you get to the underground water had it not been sitting around.(and if you have other water sources, you don’t need the well) So, without technology, people will be living in conditions worse than a lot of animals, which knows how to use tools and even make tools.(The Raven, for example, have been shown to bend a metal wire into a hook to hook stuff) You cannot use a cup, a glass to drink, since making such is technically technology, there will also be no plates, no knives, no folks, no spoons, no bowls, no buckets, no books, no writings, etc. Even drawing on rocks is a form of technology. Ah, there will be no fire as well, yes, fire is a normal phenomenon, but taking it to use for the betterment of human is a technology. Those who think otherwise is just ignoring the definition of technology and is spoilt too much in their easy lives, taking things for granted. The ancient people and survivors from the wild who had a really hard time starting a fire will definitely tell you otherwise. You will need fire to survive the cold in many areas on Earth, without it you will die and the method of starting it when you need it is not naturally occuring and thus a technology human created. So, some may argue technology isn’t needed but only wanted by people, but the truth is, without technology, human will not be humans, they will be primitive animals than a long list of mammals, birds, octopi, etc.

Do people really need technology in their lives? Is it really necessity? Except for medical technology, no. Without medical technology, I would have dies at least 3 times before I was 27. That sounds weird. There were at least 3 times before I was 27 that I would have died without medical technology. That sounds better. Other than that, have you ever been camping? It was fun for three or four days, and then it got old really fast. It took forever to do things. And if you had to scrounge for your own food, it was worse. Nd you started out with shelter and fire for heat, clothes for protection, especially footwear, and tools. Did you miss technology? I bet you did. I worked in a library for just over 20 years and I can do more research on my iPad mini than I could in a library with a full reference department at my fingertips just 20 years ago. Technology is great! It’s not a necessity, except for medical technology, but would we have that without the rest of it? No, I don’t think so.

Yes. People tend to forget that the term “technology” doesn’t just apply to recent inventions, nor does it mean just stuff. It is the techniques that humans have invented for dealing with the world, and the things created using those techniques. Farming is a technology. Cooking is a technology. Building houses is a technology. Making clothing is a technology. Hunting is a technology. Tool-making is a technology. Without technology, the only food you have is what you can hunt and pick with your bare hands. You have no clothing, no shelter beyond what you can find in nature, no fire. Language and society can even be considered technologies, so you can’t talk, and can’t form social groups beyond families. Technology is, in a very literal sense, what makes us different from other animals.

For so many people in the world, there is no possible way they could live without technology. Whether it be their mobile phone or even, like me, their very livelihood. Technology has so intertwined itself with our lives that to think of living without technology is pretty much unthinkable. By technology I mean just about all of the thingamajigs and whatchamacallits we have surrounding us every day. From cars to cell phones. From fridges to televisions and everything in between our modern world is rife with technology. So much so that if it were all to be taken away is an unthinkable event. Yet what if it actually happened? This was a premise visited by a science fiction author whom I can't remember now where the magician Merlin was half woken from a deep sleep and used his magic to prevent any technology from working and actively destroy any technology around him. Basically reducing peoples lives to the level of the times of Camelot which had a very low level of technology. Not much different from the American Amish population. The Amish population actually is proof of the pudding that we really don't need technology to have happy and fulfilling lives. Not just the Amish as well. There are plenty of populations in these modern times which survive and thrive without technology as we know today. However, technology does make for an easier, longer and I would say healthier life. Some may contest this and say that technology is actually the cause for making us sicker and less healthy in general. Yet, (I would say but but everybody has one of those) technology is the reason our lifespan has increased from an average of forty to an average of more than eighty years. Technology has all but eradicated diseases which have almost eradicated the human race and technology has shrunk the world until we are almost a unified race. I say almost but there is still a lot of work to be done.

As an MS degree in technology leadership and a software developer, I believe that technology is as fundamental as air. Simple tools have evolved into cutting tools which in turn have helped us to find more rare earth elements. These rare earth elements are used in materials chemistry to create the communications technology essential for us to defeat our alien enemies. As the Air that we breathe become more so filled with chemical elements of man made corporate waste, time wears thin. And though technology may be to blame for this hourglass of doom, the disfunctions and delays of malfunctioning  computers and misused software for crime seem pale in comparison to communications software systems machines which play a key role each moment in keeping humanity safe from extinction from any foreign or galactic threat. Technology is actually humanities intent to find permanence and immortality by any means possible. Technology as the hope and extension of humanity is the only chance for our race to resist the weaponry and deciet stemming from governments and terrorists' thirst for power. It is communications technology that the barbarian / pirate is too dim witted grasp, and as effect any genius programmer can write code in which to monitor, study, and paralyze, apprehend, or even physically trap and defeat him. The same goes for alien races that we fight regularly unbeknown to many there are hundreds of races of technologically advanced beings that monitor and have monitored earth and humanity for thousands of years. Some races are older and less of a threat to humanity than other races but we continue to thrive not because of our unity and our courage. It is because of our deep hunger for space travel and communications technology that we have not been fast to adapt to the high traffic invasion of earth and moon. Only just 100 years were scientists made aware of the craft that fly by and study humans each day and some species are caught and their technology reverse engineered not just in the USA either. Roswell is simple compared to what has been retrieved in total. Not to turn this into a science fiction response I prefer to stick to the truth: that technology will always have the upper hand when it comes to what is right no matter how flawed our race becomes: the deadliest technology will be handed to the innocent and they will know exactly what to do with it to defeat our enemies. Guaranteed.

Do humans really need technology? It’s not so much a question of whether humans need technology - of course we do. It’s a question of how much technology we need, and whether we need more or less than we already have. If you’re a neo-Luddite, then you probably believe that we have too much technology, and that we should go back to a simpler time when the world was less populated.  Luddite - Wikipedia How far back is another question. Do we simply revert to a pre-industrial society and live in small farming and pastoral communities? Or do we return back to a pre-agrarian society of illiterate hunters and gatherers? Any such backward looking movement is destined to fail, as some people in these low technology societies will inevitably choose to innovate. Moving in the direction of more and better technology offers the promise of ending the tragedies of the human condition. An end to world hunger, peace on earth, eternal vitality, and the chance to become an interstellar species. An end to boredom and frustration. Of course, technology won’t save us unless we find a way to peacefully coexist with other humans and all other life forms.

Technology does not cause need; rather, it is the effect of our ability to use technology to satisfy needs that are necessitated by human conditions or human choices. Technology is inevitable in our everyday lives. This is because life without technology is pointless in today’s dynamic world. Technology, which brings together tools to promote development, use and information exchange, has as its main objective of making tasks easier and the solving of many problems of mankind. When technology progresses and makes our lives even more convenient, we must stress how beneficial it is to our lives. As a result of technological advances, they are increasing and spreading across countries. It is innovation that gives the power to spread their wings to organizations. The positive impact of technology on society has brought change and helped us to reach new heights that have never before been conceived of. Nobody else has changed technology’s way of life, and that is precisely why technology is and will always be so important today. so Technology is important in our daily life in many ways that we cannot ignore purposefully.

You don’t need technology. You want it. The media does a great job telling you which products ‘everyone’ is buying. Listen, 200 years consumer electronics did not exist. 20 years ago the mobile phone did not exist. Now today everyone has a cell phone. The world is changing for the better. If you lived in a forest by yourself, you would not need technology. You could be self-sustaining but you may not be efficient. Technology increases productivity across the board. It helps old and young people. To communicate and connect with people all across the world. The coronavirus crisis today is a great example of why technology has become in society. Today everyone is more connected while being socially distant.

It really depends on your definition of "need" and "technology". Necessity is the mother of invention, so therefore it can be said that humans developed technology as a "need", as we advanced up the Maslow's hierarchy - making physiological and safety needs more efficient in terms of distribution and production, as well as discovering ways of connection to reach the upper levels of "needs". As for the hypothetical situation whereby all modern technology is suddenly removed or if a virus destroyed all electronic networks, I would think that mass chaos will arise with the fall of capitalism and existing institutions. As these digital pillars collapse, we should enter the second Dark Age of civilisation. The world's population will shrink. A feudal age will arise and in the midst of panic and uncertainty, religions or personality cults, will once again rise to the forefront of culture and education.

My understanding is that the human jaw is no longer strong enough to eat raw meat. That means all our meat needs to be cooked for us to eat. Fire means a burning stick or flint or something similar to start a fire. Technology. I would guess that the parts of the world that you could survive on with just fruits and vegetables and nuts and the like and are not already occupied by others is about zero. Grains need a grinding stone. As a wild guess, if humans lost all technology, the world could support only about 1% of the current population. Probably a lot less. The purpose of life is more life. My purpose is to help propagate life throughout the universe. Vita Ueber Allen. Life Universally Triumphant. “Be kind to me, or treat me mean. I’ll make the most of it --- I’m an extraordinary machine.” ---- Fiona Apple. Edit Draft Follow · 3 Request  Ralph Lake, Scientism follower

Here in the US there are groups of people such as the Amish that try to live their lives with as little modern technology as possible. They seem to live full and healthy lives. I personally am not against technology but limit it in my life. There are just some things you have to do to function in the current society. My grown children while very techno savvy really try to limit its use and influence in their families lives. I have a television that I rarely turn on. If I do it’s to watch a movie or documentary. I cannot recall the last time I actually watched a program of any type on network television. My sons family does not have a television. They have one laptop. My daughter in law does web page design and maintenance. But you never see her on a computer. My son and daughter in law each have a smart phone but almost never answer. They often leave their home with the kids without a phone. They get along just fine.

We not only need technology, we need even more advanced technology. I'm assuming that "need" here means that it is necessary to maintain human survival (and reasonable lifestyle). If we don't continue to increase our technological capabilities, we will not survive the next few thousand years. Our carrying capacity is limited given current capabilities. Technology has the potential to give the human race the ability to last for millions of years or more. I don't want us to die out around the year 4000, so I would say that we absolutely require further increases in technological sophistication.

Do you need the technology in your kitchen to safely store and prepare your food? The refrigerator, the stove, knives, they're all technology. How about the technology that goes into your house? The foundation, the walls, the roof, windows, doors, carpet, floors, furniture, all technology. Do you walk around naked and barefoot? Plenty of technology went into the clothes and shoes you wear. Automobiles, roads, bicycles, airplanes, everything we use to travel is all technology. So, yeah, damn near impossible to avoid using some sort of technology in your daily life. Humans became the superior species because of our ability to make technology to overcome our weaknesses.

I’d say yes, to a degree. Power, heat running water etc. are nice. I was talking it over with a friend who taught me more about the Civil Rights movement than I could read in any book. We talked for a while about slavery. I told him that my family never lived on a plantation and got exploited by some punk in the main house. But I also told him none of his family ever got shoved into a gas chamber via a trip to an oven. Who’s the slave master today? Take a look at that little rectangle people can’t seem to live without. Techno-slavery? If we’re all caught up in the 4g web, the question remains is the spider who spun that web winking at you out of his eight little eyes or are those eyes giving you an uncomfortable glare?

We are a bit of an anomaly among apex predators.  We're not particularly big or strong.  We're frail and light.  We don't have sharp teeth and our fingernails are not useful for injuring things in the same way that claws are.  The primary advantage we have over the lions and tigers and bears (oh my) is that we can make spears.  So at a fundamental level we need technology.  Beyond that, if you plunged a city into the stone age tomorrow, they'd all be dead in a month.  Guaranteed.  No refrigeration, no pasteurization, no water filtration, no air filtration, no sewage treatment, no agriculture...  It would be a disaster.

Yes. Our food is grown using technology. Our water is purified using technology. We travel and communicate over long distances using technology. Even without computers, we would need certain forms of technology just to survive. The world's populations would not currently be able to survive simply on food found in the wild. We have been reliant on technology for thousand of years.

Think about this... Kolkata to  Delhi, Distance- 1532km before 1850:People would take more than  13 days (asuming walking/bulock card         speed of 5-10 kmph non stop) 1866: 1st railway line link between Kolkata and delhi. It took 45hrs(with all the halts in the stations) 1969: Rajdhani express takes 17hrs 20 minutes.  It used to have no intermediate passenger stop, however it had technical halt at Gomoh, Mughalsarai and Kanpur Central for refilling of the overhead water tank and to replenish the on-board catering stores. It was fastest train of India that time 2016: Rajdhani express takes 16hrs 55 min (including all stopages) If you take a flight, it will take less than 2hrs.  So basically we can see, there is always a hunger in human being to make a better and faster technology that can help us to transform and have a great future. This is the advancement of technology. So until and unless new technologies were implemented in our lives, this advancement would not have been possible.  Who knows probably we would me able to use nuclear fuel to generate energy for our engines and make our trains much safer to withstand a higher speed. Then it would take 1hr or even less to cover 1000 km and there will always be a curious mind who would say "Hey why not cover the distance in less time".

Humans? Technically, no. Humanity? Yes. Humanity, Co-operation, agriculture depend on technology. So does war... Without technology, your life would be very simple; eat what you can findkill or be killedDo you mean a particular level of technology advancement? For example, after we developed farming, healthcare, electricity, diplomacy, it was good enough ? Do we really need smartwatches and Netflix? That is an interesting, but very different question...

Short Answer: Technology improves our standard of living and make life easier. Long Answer: Had Prometheus not shown mankind the ways of fire, opening Pandora's box in the process, We wouldn't have been able to get that extra UMPH out of the food our Hunter-Gather ancestors gathered. This allowed for Tribes to form, which then had its own needs for technology. Tools were quintessential for reducing labor and developing specialties. Technology is responsible for improving humanity’s wants and needs since the dawn of mankind because there is a symbiotic mutualism going on between man and, now, machine.

The more ingrained technology becomes in society the more it becomes a necessity. It’s hard to imagine life without a refrigerator. But there was a time when a refrigerator was new technology. Cars, cell phones, computers have become so ingrained in society they are rapidly becoming a necessity to do business. Not keeping up with established technologies will make it harder for you to get and keep a job. It will make it harder to do business with others.

Do we really need it? No, we don’t. For most of the existence of mankind, we were decidedly no or low tech. But life expectancy was very low. Communications outside the family almost nonexistent. Traveling any distance impossible. So while technology can be frustrating, it’s an integral part of our lives.

8Hell no Let me explain basically technology is for better tomorrow for our next generation and so on. But we are keep on using earth resources to build and update technology currently we have. Like 4G to 5G 6G, Moon to Mars, Atomic bomb to hydrogen bomb, 1st world War , 2nd world War to may be 3rd. Our children need water to drink food to eat they can't drink and eat this stupid technology. _/\_ Till now what ever we created is enough no need of 2.0 and 3.0 versions. Humans are no longer part of the nature we became antonym of nature. Finally if we create one thing it will have reset button (ex: mobile). So, never forgot nature do have reset button we shouldn't make it pressed. Sorry for my English.

It depends on where you live. If you live in a city, you need technology because evrybody will be using it and you have to engage in the community. However, if you live in a village in the countryside, you can get away without technology, just as people in ancient time did.

What's an interest question. As role of Tech Entrepreneur, it's definitely yes! Let assume that without technology how can you travel from London to Singapore for 12 hours. If you using house, ship to go it could take 3, 4 months to get there. So the question is how you life better without technology. There's no hi-tech machine that help people discover space, universe, there is no way to find how cure your sick, cancer without radiation. Why don't you ask you self whether your life is better with significant helps of technology?

No Homo sapiens dis pretty well for 200,000 years without high tech. And no, Fire, flints, and arrows are not technology - that just picking up a rock and sharp stick is not deep technology. And an argument can be made that the rapid pace of modern high tech life will destroy the human race in short order. How is your brain doing on high tech pharma and 24/7 work days? Stressed to the breaking point…right? I am:)

The word "Technology" is so broad that it becomes inescapable. Create a hut with a door? A weapon? Tools? BOOM technology. Your question is answered simply by this: Did we make it to today without having current technology in the past? If yes, then we didn't need modern tech back then.But it sure would have helped.

It depends on what you are trained on. I'm sure that tribes in the Amazon jungle have their own technology, even if it's what to use to make poisons for the spears and darts and how to make a bow or blowgun. What seperates us from most animals is our use of tools, and that is technology. If you grew up in a city in the US then I doubt you could survive without a certain level of technology you are familiar with.

See you cannot give a specific answer to this question cause there are types of technology there are the essential one and the add-ons if I can say like you need a phone to communicate for urgencies for exemple but u don't need a high end smartphone if you just gonna use it for calls so it depends on the purpose of the technology . In general the technology is needed but the degree of needing to it it's relative from person to another.

The modern technology has additionally given approaches to develop more food, transport more individuals and make more items for a developing society. Another greatest advantages of modern technology is that human health have enhanced in light of its application. As information of the body and its capacities enhances, and as new tools to mend it are made, life keeps going longer. Does life reach out, as well as individuals can live all the more easily, and recuperate from wounds and sicknesses that even an a large portion of a century back would have been deadly.

We survived for millennia without it, but life got better as we began to harness technologies. So basically "no" we don't absolutely need it, but I can't imagine any sane person wants to go back to hunting wooly mammoths and wearing animal skins.

Yes, but at the level of spears, baskets, and net bags, not at the level of moon rockets and computers. There are sometimes questions about men defeating large predators bare handed on Quora. This is almost impossible but very seldom necessary because with even the simple technology we had 100,000 years ago we became at least their match. Tool and weapon making is an intrinsic part of who we are.
You can answer this experimentally. Get rid of all of your tech stuff. In a few months report back on how its going. Oh, wait, you won't be able to use Quora.
